key.name: directory
key.description: Specify the directory path where logs will be saved

key.name: level
key.description: Control the verbosity of logs

key.name: rotate
key.description: Number of time log files are rotated before being removed. If the value is 0, old versions are removed rather than rotated.

key.name: reporters
key.description: Specify the name of the metrics reporters to use. At the moment it supports the 'console', 'carbon', 'jsonlogfile' and 'logfile' reporters. If left empty metrics are not reported.

key.name: prefix
key.description: Specify the prefix assigned to each metric.

key.name: server-address
key.description: Specify the carbon server address.

key.name: server-port
key.description: Specify the carbon server TCP port.

key.name: smooth-range
key.description: Provides most fluid experience

key.name: sharp-range
key.description: Provides best image quality

key.name: enabled-codecs
key.description: Specifies the name of the display codecs to use. An empty list enables all display codecs. The display codecs are ['h264', 'jpeg', 'lz4']

key.name: enable-yuv444-decoding
key.description: If enabled, the client will prefer the YUV444 format in codec capabilities negotiation. Notice that if the setting is disabled then enable-high-color-accuracy will take precedence in case the server supports it.

key.name: lossless-colorspace
key.description: Select the colorspace with the lossless layer. This helps to reduce some coloring artifacts due to mixing the YUV colorspace (H.264 and JPEG layers) with the lossless layer, normally in the RGB colorspace. The colorspaces are ['rgb', 'yuv_rec601', 'yuv_rec709']

key.name: enable-hardware-decoder
key.description: If enabled, the client will prefer the hardware decoder to the software one for H264

key.name: enable-pixel-format-selection
key.description: If enabled, the client will prefer the pixel formats which are best to offload work to gpu

key.name: enable-vaapi
key.summary: Enable hardware rendering of Video Acceleration API (VA-API) surfaces
key.description: If enabled, VA-API surfaces will be directly rendered. This setting requires * enable-hardware-decoder=true * enable-pixel-format-selection=true

key.name: adaptive-resolution
key.summary: Whether to resize the server desktop automatically
key.description: If set the client will ask the server to resize the desktop to the size of the client.

key.name: resolution
key.summary: The resolution to resize the server desktop
key.description: If adaptive-resolution is false this settings is the one in charge of setting the custom resolution server side.

key.name: enable-qu
key.description: Specifies whether to enable quality updates.

key.name: enable-high-color-accuracy
key.description: Sets the high color accuracy server side. The feature is available since DCV 2022.0. To statically configure a server not supporting this feature, use enable-yuv444-decoding.

key.name: enable-metrics-in-toolbar
key.description: If enabled the metrics will be visible in the toolbar.

key.name: enable-smartcard-redirection
key.description: If enabled smartcard devices are redirected to the remote host.

key.name: accurate-audio-video-sync
key.description: Accurate audio/video synchronization is enabled on the remotization.

key.name: enable-high-pixel-density
key.description: If enabled high pixel density will be used when rendering. macOS only.

key.name: debug-layer
key.summary: Wether to paint the different regions with a color
key.description: If set to true, the regions on the layers will be painted in different colors.

key.name: web-port
key.summary: TCP port for the WebSocket transport
key.description: Specify the port to use for the TCP connection.

key.name: quic-port
key.summary: UDP port for the QUIC transport
key.description: Specify the port to use for the UDP connection.

key.name: transport
key.description: Specify the transport to use between 'auto', 'websocket' and 'quic'.

key.name: dqt-alpn-versions
key.summary: Specify the DQT application versions meant to be used during connection establishment
key.description:
Specify a list of supported ALPN versions required by client. During handshake, the server will select the first available matching from the list, in order. Therefore, the list is ordered by version selection preferences.
Currently, the following version values are supported: - Dqt10 - Dqt02Draft - Dqt01Draft - Dcv20Basic

key.name: custom-channels
key.description: Specify the custom channels as list of channel names with format namespace::name.

key.name: enable-unreliable-input
key.summary: Whether to enable the unreliable transport for input.
key.description: This is an experimental setting. When enabled it, it allows transmission of input data over unreliable transport increasing the responsiveness.

key.name: enable-timezone-redirection
key.summary: Whether to enable the timezone redirection.
key.description: Specify whether to send local timezone information to the server.

key.name: enable-printer-redirection
key.summary: Whether to enable the printer redirection.
key.description: Specify whether to enable printer redirection. This enables the client printers to be available in the server.

key.name: selected-webcam
key.description: Specify the ID of the webcam in the preferences dialog.

key.name: ciphers
key.summary: Cipher list used on the TLS connections
key.description: Cipher list used on the TLS connections. The cipher list must be separated using the character ":" and must be supported by openssl.

key.name: playback-channels
key.summary: The number of audio channels used for playback
key.description: The number of audio channels to be used for multicahnnel playback. Supported values: 2 (Stereo), 4 (Quadriphonic), 6 (Surround 5.1), 8 (Surround 7.1). If 0 stereo will be considered.

key.name: buffer-time
key.description: Sets the buffer-time in ms used to play the audio on the local speakers. Default value 40 ms.

key.name: buffer-time-avsync
key.summary: Audio buffer-time in when A/V Sync is active
key.description: Sets the buffer-time in ms used to play the audio on the local speakers when A/V Sync is active.

key.name: frame-length
key.description: Sets the frame-length in ms used to grab the audio on the server. If missing or 0 the server default will be considered.

key.name: enable-control-click-as-right-click
key.summary: Whether to treat Control + Left-Click as Right-Click on MacOS
key.description: Defines how to handle Control + Left-Click events in MacOS. If set to 'true', MacOS will treat Control + Left-Click combinations as Right-Click. If set to 'false', MacOS will treat Control + Left-Click combinations as Left-Click.

key.name: option-key-mode
key.summary: Behavior of the Option key on MacOS
key.description: Defines how to handle keyboard combinations which include the Option key. If set to 'local', MacOS will allow the user to compose UTF-8 sequences. If set to 'alt', the Option key will be mapped to the remote Alt modifier.

key.name: command-key-mode
key.summary: Behavior of the Command key on MacOS
key.description: Defines how to handle the remote Command key behaviour. If set to 'control', it will send a remote Control key. If set to 'meta', t will send a remote Meta key.

key.name: grab-all-keys
key.summary: Whether to grab the keyboard device to redirect all the keys.
key.description: If enabled, the keyboard device will be grabbed and all the keys will be redirected. Device grabbing might have problems depending on the platform or windowing system, so enable this setting at your own risk of blocking your whole system. Deprecated: use grab-keyboard-mode setting.

key.name: grab-keyboard-mode
key.summary: Whether to grab the keyboard device to redirect all the keys.
key.description: Defines if the keyboard device will grab all the keys. If set to 'on-fullscreen' the keyboard device is grabbed only on fullscreen mode. If set to 'always' the keyboard device will be grabbed always. If set to 'never' the keyboard device will not be grabbed. Note that device grabbing might have problems depending on the platform or windowing system, so enable this setting at your own risk of blocking your whole system.

key.name: map-control-alt-end-to-sas
key.summary: Whether to map Control+Alt+End to Control+Alt+Del.
key.description: If enabled, Control+Alt+End will be mapped to Control+Alt+Del. Normally Control+Alt+Del will be handled by the operating system and the viewer will not be able to send it, for this we provide this mapping to still be able to send it to the remote instance.

key.name: load-policy
key.summary: Determines if extensions are checked for digital signatures or not.
key.description: The valid values are 'all' or 'only-signed' (default='only-signed'). If 'all' is specified, extensions will be loaded without checking if the executable contains a valid digital signature. If 'only-signed' is specified, extensions will only be loaded if their executable contains a valid digital signature.
